Package org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.certextensions

Class CertificateExtension

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.certextensions.CertificateExtension
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicCertificateExtension, StandardCertificateExtension
    public abstract class CertificateExtension
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Base class for a certificate extension. All extensions should inherit this class. The methods that need implementation is getValue
    Version:
    $Id: CertificateExtension.java 29873 2018-09-13 09:36:27Z aminkh $
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getProperties

        public Properties getProperties()
        The properties configured for this extension. The properties are stripped of the beginning "idX.property.". So searching for the property "id1.property.value" only the key "value" should be used in the returned property.
        Returns:
        the properties configured for this certificate extension.

      • init

        public void init​(int id,
                 String oID,
                 String displayName,
                 boolean criticalFlag,
                 boolean requiredFlag,
                 Properties extensionProperties)
        Method that initializes the CertificateExtension
        Parameters:
        id - the uniqueID of the extension
        oID - the OID
        displayName - the DN
        criticalFlag - if the extension should be marked as critical or not.
        requiredFlag - if the extension should be marked as required or not.
        extensionProperties - the complete configuration property file.

      • getValue

        public abstract org.bouncycastle.asn1.ASN1Encodable getValue​(EndEntityInformation userData,
                                                             CA ca,
                                                             CertificateProfile certProfile,
                                                             PublicKey userPublicKey,
                                                             PublicKey caPublicKey,
                                                             CertificateValidity val)
                                                      throws CertificateExtensionException
        Deprecated.
        Callers should use the getValueEncoded method as this method might not be supported by all implementations. Implementors can still implement this method if they prefer as it gets called from getValueEncoded.
        Method that should return the ASN1Encodable value used in the extension this is the method at all implementors must implement.
        Parameters:
        userData - the userdata of the issued certificate.
        ca - the CA data with access to all the keys etc. For CA certificates, this is the CA itself.
        certProfile - the certificate profile
        userPublicKey - public key of the user, or null if not available
        caPublicKey - public key of the CA, or null if not available
        val - validity of certificate where the extension will be added
        Returns:
        a ASN1Encodable or null, if this extension should not be used, which was determined from the values somehow.
        Throws:
        CertificateExtensionException - if there was an error constructing the certificate extension

      • getValueEncoded

        public byte[] getValueEncoded​(EndEntityInformation userData,
                              CA ca,
                              CertificateProfile certProfile,
                              PublicKey userPublicKey,
                              PublicKey caPublicKey,
                              CertificateValidity val)
                       throws CertificateExtensionException
        Method that should return the byte[] value used in the extension. The default implementation of this method first calls the getValue() method and then encodes the result as an byte array. CertificateExtension implementors has the choice of overriding this method if they want to include byte[] data in the certificate that is not necessarily an ASN.1 structure otherwise the getValue method can be implemented as before.
        Parameters:
        userData - the userdata of the issued certificate.
        ca - the CA data with access to all the keys etc
        certProfile - the certificate profile
        userPublicKey - public key of the user, or null if not available
        caPublicKey - public key of the CA, or null if not available
        val - validity of certificate where the extension will be added
        Returns:
        a byte[] or null, if this extension should not be used, which was determined from the values somehow.
        Throws:
        CertificateExtensionException - if there was an error constructing the certificate extensio
